org.gvsig.gui
Class ModalDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      org.gvsig.gui.ModalDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ModalDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog

An extension of the JDialog that overrides the JVM's typical modal behaviour. This typical behaviour is that when a modal dialog is opened, all other windows cease to respond to user events until the modal dialog is disposed. However this prevents us opening the help documents property whenever a modal dialog is open. Thus we override the modal behaviour so that only the owner frame or dialog is blocked. Note that because we always call the super constructor with modal set to false, this should be made visible with setVisible(true) rather than show() which will return straight away.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

dispose

Overrides:
dispose in class java.awt.Window

makeVisible

public void makeVisible()
Ensures the current dialog is visible.

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visible)
The set visible method is overriden to provide modal functionality. It essentially hijacks control of the event dispatch thread while the dialog is open, only allowing non-user events to be passed to the parent dialog. Furthermore it only has this effect within the current AWT component tree by utilitizing the TreeLock.

Overrides:
setVisible in class java.awt.Dialog
Parameters:
visible - true if this dialog should be painted on-screen, false otherwise.

setModal

public void setModal(boolean modal)
Overridden method so we can control modality and not rely on the Dialog default.

Overrides:
setModal in class java.awt.Dialog
Parameters:
modal - true if this dialog should be modal, ie block user actions to its owner window, false otherwise.
